Event.name: Change_event_duration
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> changes the duration of an <fen>Event</fen>. The <fen>Event</fen> will then take place for a <fen>New_duration</fen>, rather than the <fen>Initial_duration</fen>. This can be done with by certain <fen>Means</fen>, in a certain <fen>Manner</fen> or to a certain <fen>Degree</fen>.
<ex>Don't let <fex name="Agent">him</fex> <t>prolong</t> <fex name="Event">the discussion</fex> <fex name="New_duration">to an absurd length</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Harsh weather made it necessary to <t>cut</t> <fex name="Event">the tour</fex> <t>short</t> <fex name="ini">from its original four months</fex> <fex name="new">to three</fex>. <fex name="Agent">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The sentient entity that changes the duration of the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Don't let <fex name="Agent">him</fex> <t>prolong</t> the discussion to an absurd length.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: New_duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The new duration of the Event.
<ex>Don't let him <t>prolong</t> the discussion <fex name="new">to an absurd length</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The planned duration of the <fen>Event</fen> before the change takes place.
<ex>Harsh weather combined made it necessary to <t>cut</t> the tour <t>short</t> <fex name="ini">from its original four months</fex> to three.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused.
<ex><fex name="tim">Last week</fex>, he unnecessarily <t>prolonged</t> the agony, thinking that he could tough it out.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the initial and final durations differ from each other.
<ex>Too bad we can't <t>extend</t> our vacation <fex name="deg">even more</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event causing the change of the Event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex>Rain <fex name="man">so cruelly</fex> <t>cut</t> <t>short</t> the game against Bangladesh.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in bringing about the change of duration.
<ex><fex name="Explanation">Why</fex> would someone <t>cut</t> our time <t>short</t> like that?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Event
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Event</fen>'s duration is changed.
<ex>Don't let him <t>prolong</t> <fex name="eve">the discussion</fex> to an absurd length.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event that causes the change in Event duration.
<ex><fex name="cau">Rain</fex> so cruelly <t>cut</t> <t>short</t> the game against Bangladesh.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by changing the duration of the Event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> (or event resulting from the <fen>Cause</fen>) that produces a change in the Event's duration.
<ex>It seems they are bent on <t>prolonging</t> conflict <fex name="mea">by ignoring normal wartime conventions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: cut short.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: abbreviate, stop prior to completion.

lexUnit.name: shorten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: decrease the duration of something.

lexUnit.name: slow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to increase the duration of something
